intro: Justicia pannieri, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which range in color from red to purple, are tubular and attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
